course.subject: PHYS
course.name: Computational Physics
course.description: This course introduces the use of computer to solve problems and to simulate physical phenomena. It covers the numerical solution of ordinary differential equations, linear systems, stochastic processes, and Monte Carlo methods. Visualization tools will be used to interpret results of the calculations.

reviews.author: Wilson Lau
reviews.title: Worth taking
reviews.comment_content: This course give more details and explanation in computational method. Course content will be very useful if you are planning to do research in future. It also cover some stock price model. You also learn and allow to use the department Unix cluster.
reviews.comment_teaching: TW CHEN is very kind and good teacher. He explain everything clearly and willing to provide lots of help. He even help me in my own research
reviews.comment_workload: 3 hrs lecture and 2 hrs of lab per week. Weekly assignment and full lab report. I think this is the most demanding course in the UG physics level. No midterm. One project for UG student, 2 for PG.
